p: Table 3 lists two other plant extracts that have been reported to exhibit antiviral activity against arboviruses, as well as the assays done to determine the proposed mode of action. Aphloia theiformis, an edible indigenous plant from La RÃ©union, as well as mushroom extracts derived from each of the four culinary and medicinal mushrooms, Lignosus rhinocerotis, Pleurotus giganteus, Hericium erinaceus and Schizophyllum commune. An overview of the plant extracts which can inhibit the different arboviruses is provided in Table 5.
